html.p: Definition. Suppose [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is a vector space over a field [mathjaxinline]F[/mathjaxinline]. A subset [mathjaxinline]W \subset V[/mathjaxinline] is a subspace of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] if [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is a vector space over [mathjaxinline]F[/mathjaxinline] in its own right, using the same vector operations as in [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline].
Proposition. A subset [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] of a vector space [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] is a subspace of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] if the following conditions hold:

li.p: [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is closed under addition; that is, for all vectors [mathjaxinline]w_1,w_2 \in W[/mathjaxinline], the sum [mathjaxinline]w_1+w_2[/mathjaxinline] is also an element of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline].

[mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] is closed under scalar multiplication; that is, for any vector [mathjaxinline]w\in W[/mathjaxinline] and scalar [mathjaxinline]a \in F[/mathjaxinline], the product [mathjaxinline]aw[/mathjaxinline] is also an element of [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline].
